title: Chocolate Flan Cake Recipe
description: This chocoflan is so impressive with its rich chocolate cake layer topped with creamy caramel flan; it makes a great centerpiece on any dessert table!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips EAGLE BRAND® Chocolate Flan Cake 4.8 (169) 139 Reviews 129 Photos This chocoflan, or chocolate flan cake, when inverted, rests on a rich chocolate cake layer and is topped with melted caramel. Submitted by Eagle brand Updated on December 5, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 129 129 129 129 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs Additional Time: 5 hrs Total Time: 7 hrs 30 mins Servings: 18 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 18 servings Crisco Original No-Stick Cooking Spray ½ cup Smucker's Caramel Flavored Topping 1 (15.25 ounce) package devil's food cake mix 1 cup water 3 large eggs ½ cup Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil Flan: 1 (14 ounce) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk 1 (12 ounce) can Pet Evaporated Milk 4 large eggs, at room temperature 4 ounces cream cheese, softened 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 12-cup fluted tube pan with nonstick spray. Place a piece of rolled-up foil into the tube part of the pan to prevent cake from spilling over the top. Pour caramel topping into the prepared pan. Beat cake mix, water, 3 eggs, and vegetable oil together in a large bowl until well combined; pour evenly over caramel topping. Combine condensed milk, evaporated milk, 4 eggs, cream cheese, and vanilla in a blender. Process until smooth; pour slowly over cake batter. While baking, the cake will rise and the milk mixture will go to the bottom. Coat a piece of foil with nonstick spray. Cover the pan tightly with foil, coated-side down. Place the pan in a large roasting pan. Pour hot water into the roasting pan to a depth of 2 inches. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs on it, about 2 hours. Place cake on a cooling rack; cool for 15 minutes. Remove foil and invert onto a serving plate. Cool for 1 hour at room temperature. Chill for 4 hours or overnight before serving. Recipe Tip Be careful when inverting hot cake onto serving plate. Place plate upside down on top of the pan, place another cooling rack on top, then invert. I Made It Print 410 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Chocolate Flan Cake 01 of 129 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 129 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/04/2025 Family favorite I make this every Ramadan and has always been one of my families favorite desserts! 03 of 129 Photo by  justme624 11/25/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Easy to follow Great flavors I liked that this cake was not very complicated to make and when I finally got it out of the pan it looked great. For a few minutes I was thinking it wouldn’t come out! I hope everyone who eats it thinks it was harder to make than it really was, lol. Thanks for a great recipe and I didn’t change anything in the recipe at all. I have made flan many times and I love it but this cake looks so unique… 04 of 129 Photo by  Jason Aleman 08/15/2024 Fantastic!!!! Didn't alter the recipe at all. It got devoured! 05 of 129 Photo by  WittyCake5061 03/03/2024 Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow First timer and it was well worth it... everyone licked the plate and no crumbs left. 06 of 129 Photo by  CalmNaan7318 12/17/2023 Recipe is good except the cake doesn't rise to the top like it should I think I'd you put the flan in first then the cake it would work much better 07 of 129 Photo by  ChillyScone5983 10/18/2023 Perfect, easy recipe! It was a hit! Now I've got everyone asking me to make it for events and trying to put orders in lol I've also switched it up after a few times making it and made strawberry 🍓 thank you so much 08 of 129 Photo by  CraftyMelon2409 06/01/2023 My family and I absolutely love this cake ! It came out great and is so delicious ! I made it a few times and each time it came out perfect ! 09 of 129 Photo by  Alicia Marie Profetto 05/28/2023 Such a show stopper 10 of 129 Photo by  Jean 05/27/2023 I have made this cake several times, the exact same way. I let the cake cool down a bit before I flip it. It always comes out delicious. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Eagle Brand Chocolate Fondue 195 Ratings Butterscotch Blondies 86 Ratings Blueberry Streusel Cobbler 109 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Ice Cream Sandwich Dessert 3 Ratings Chocolate Swirled Peppermint Fudge 5 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl Fudge 54 Ratings Eagle Brand Peanut Butter Fudge 116 Ratings Layered Mint Chocolate Fudge 163 Ratings Caramel Flans from EAGLE BRAND 11 Ratings Chocolate Caramel Commotion Bars 5 Ratings Caramel Apple Streusel Squares 9 Ratings Classic Key Lime Pie 133 Ratings Foolproof Chocolate Fudge 245 Ratings Pink Lemonade Pie from Eagle Brand 11 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Chip Cookies 7 Ratings Eagle Brand Chocolate Truffles 27 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Eagle brand
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 12-cup fluted tube pan with nonstick spray. Place a piece of rolled-up foil into the tube part of the pan to prevent cake from spilling over the top. Pour caramel topping into the prepared pan.;Beat cake mix, water, 3 eggs, and vegetable oil together in a large bowl until well combined; pour evenly over caramel topping.;Combine condensed milk, evaporated milk, 4 eggs, cream cheese, and vanilla in a blender. Process until smooth; pour slowly over cake batter. While baking, the cake will rise and the milk mixture will go to the bottom.;Coat a piece of foil with nonstick spray. Cover the pan tightly with foil, coated-side down. Place the pan in a large roasting pan. Pour hot water into the roasting pan to a depth of 2 inches.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs on it, about 2 hours.;Place cake on a cooling rack; cool for 15 minutes. Remove foil and invert onto a serving plate. Cool for 1 hour at room temperature. Chill for 4 hours or overnight before serving.
